Sure, here are a few tips to help you get around Lisbon as a tourist:

1. Use public transportation - Lisbon has a well-developed public transportation system that is affordable and efficient. The metro, buses, and trams are all reliable modes of transportation, and the Carris/Metro app can be very helpful in navigating these systems. 2. Buy a Lisboa Card - The Lisboa Card is a great option for tourists as it provides unlimited access to public transportation, discounts on popular attractions, and free admission to many museums and monuments. 3. Walk around - Lisbon is a beautiful city with a lot of history and charm, so walking is a great way to explore the city and discover hidden gems. 4. Take a tuk-tuk tour - Tuk-tuks are a popular mode of transportation for tourists in Lisbon, and they offer a fun and unique way to see the city. There are many companies that offer tuk-tuk tours, and they can be a great way to see the city's highlights in a short amount of time. 5. Take the tram 28 - Tram 28 is an iconic Lisbon attraction that takes you through some of the city's most historic neighborhoods. It's a must-do for any tourist visiting Lisbon. 6. Consider a day trip - Lisbon is surrounded by beautiful towns and cities that are easy to reach by public transportation, so consider taking a day trip to explore the region. Popular destinations include Sintra, Cascais, and Belem.
